text.p: In this lab exercise, you are tasked to complete the playAgain() method in the Player class. This method asks the user for some input, to determine whether to play the game again or not.

ol.li: A loop should be used to complete this task.

Declare a variable of type char. You can declare a char variable by coding:
charÂ variableName;
Output a message on the terminal window to ask the user indicating if he/she wants to play the game again by entering the character y or n.
Read the character from the user by using the IO.inputCharacter() method. Assign the read character to the declared char variable.
Check the character read from the user. If the character is neither y nor Y nor n nor N, ask the user to input again by repeating step 3.
Otherwise, if the character is y or Y, return the value true, else return the value false.
